agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Pensions, Investments & Financial Services TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 4, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Jim Murphy The committee will meet to consider the following: HB 2173 Murphy Relating to the regulation of state banks, state trust companies, and third-party service providers of state banks and state trust companies. HB 2458 Capriglione Relating to the operation and administration of the Texas Bullion Depository. HB 2469 Gutierrez Relating to retirement benefits for certain peace officers who are members of the Teacher Retirement System of Texas. HB 2636 Flynn Relating to enforcement of the regulation of perpetual care cemeteries. HB 2639 Flynn Relating to debt cancellation agreements offered in connection with certain retail installment contracts. HB 2697 Meyer Relating to the prosecution of the offense of fraudulent use or possession of identifying information. HB 2779 Wray Relating to the exemption for certain savings plans from attachment, execution, or other seizure for a creditor's claim. HB 2821 Flynn Relating to credit in, benefits from, and administration of the Texas Municipal Retirement System. HB 2950 Guillen Relating to perpetual care trust funds and a master trust account. HB 3188 Gervin-Hawkins Relating to the retirement system in certain municipalities for firefighters and police officers. HB 3247 Martinez | et al. Relating to the Texas Emergency Services Retirement System. SB 12 Huffman | et al. Relating to the contributions to and benefits under the Teacher Retirement System of Texas. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: SB 12 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
